findings.title: Weak AES Encryption in Plug-in bitcoinj
findings.description: The implementation of `encryptNoEC()/decryptNoEC()` in `bitcoinj` uses AES/ECB/NoPadding mode which can be broken by decrypting one arbitrary block, although the flawed API is not used in the current implementation.

findings.title: Possible Privilege Escalation in Plug-in xuexiangjys
findings.description: Privilege escalation vulnerability in plug-in xuexiangjys

findings.title: ZipperDown Vulnerability in Plug-in xuexiangjys
findings.description: The implementation of QR code scanning imports a third-party plug-in with a `ZipperDown` loophole. The function `getName()` has not validated the name of the to be unzipped file, allowing an adversary to construct a malicious `zip` file and potentially overlap with an existing file.

findings.title: Implicit Intent Invocation in Plug-in xuexiangjys
findings.description: The implementation of QR code scanning imports a third-party plug-in and uses implicit intent invocation, which might lead to privacy content leak.

findings.title: Arbitrary Backup of Private Data
findings.description: In Android, the android:allowBackup attribute defines whether application data can be backed up and restored by a user who has enabled usb debugging.

findings.title: Possible Private Key Leakage through Clipboard
findings.description: During the process of storing and exporting the private key, there is a potential risk which may result in the compromise of the private key due to malicious applications having access to the clipboard.

findings.title: Flawed System Security Validation
findings.description: The mobile platform's underlying operating system has been 'root' ed or somehow 'hook' ed, allowing an adversary to obtain local device information and private keys through code injection techniques.

findings.title: Unsafe Storage of Private Key and Mnemonic Words
findings.description: Possessing the private key and the mnemonic words is equivalent to having the right to dispose the asset in corresponding wallet.

findings.title: Vulnerability in Outdated Web Plug-in resolve-url-loader
findings.description: The imported library `resolve-url-loader v3.1.1` contains several known vulnerabilities, the most severe one could lead to `denial-of-service` to block normal services.

findings.title: No Strength Validation on Password Setting
findings.description: The password setting in the Web wallet does not perform a validation on the chosen password strength.

findings.title: Lack of Network Proxy Detection
findings.description: The applications on iOS or Android platforms do not detect the presence of a network proxy, allowing potential man-in-the-middle attacks.
